shortdesc.ph: Adjusts the volume of the custom external audio source when it is published in the channel.

p.codeblock: public abstract int adjustCustomAudioPublishVolume(int sourceId, int volume);
virtual int adjustCustomAudioPublishVolume(int32_t sourceId, int volume) = 0;
public abstract int AdjustCustomAudioPublishVolume(int sourceId, int volume);
Future<void> adjustCustomAudioPublishVolume( {required int sourceId, required int volume});

section.title: Details
section.note: Ensure you have called the method to create an external audio track before calling this method.
section.p: If you want to change the volume of the audio to be published, you need to call this method again.

plentry.pd: The ID of external audio source. If you want to publish a custom external audio source, set this parameter to the ID of the corresponding custom audio track you want to publish.
The volume of the audio source. The value can range from 0 to 100. 0 means mute; 100 means the original volume.

section.p: When the method call succeeds, there is no return value; when fails, the exception is thrown; you need to catch the exception and handle it accordingly.
